We got problems dawg.

  • Security has become a used car lot
  • Useless metrics pollute our interfaces
  • nothing has structure
  • we are spinning in place
  • but chill... we'll get to that

Snorby All About Simplicity

  • Born in 2009 while I hated my job.
  • Open Source - For the love of it.
  • Simple with a bit of structure
  • Was designed for our clients. Explain...
  • A lot of fun and how I learned to program

For The Noobs

  • Reads IDS events from a database
  • Simple (worthless?!?) metrics
  • Plugin to view transcript and pcap data
  • Easy to deploy - yes, it is.
  • BASE replacment I guess.
  • Not ugly more important than you would think

The Good

  • Classify Events
  • Notes, Favorite & Remember
  • Plugins (kinda?)
  • Simple Time based metrics
  • Reporting, mostly useful for export needs
  • Not ugly more important than you would think

The Bad

  • FUCKING WEB SCALE!@#!@#!@#!@#!@#!
  • Database fails...
  • Ruby/Rails
  • Not Ugly... huh?

The Future of "Snorby"

  • Go-lang (http://www.golang.org)
  • WORKFLOW.. SRSLY.. THIS IS IMPORTANT
  • i'm calm now.. we'll talk about that more later.
  • Performance
  • It's still going to be pretty
  • Collaboration
  • New Name, Project and new Reasons for making it.

It's Secret Still!

WTF is Go?

Well...

  • It's Amazing
  • All about concurrency
  • C type performance (kinda) but easy to write. Srsly (real talk).
  • If you use python or ruby.. I suggest learning this instead.
  • The language of the cloud
  • Large community and growing..

Go Channels

package main
import "fmt"

func main() {
    messages := make(chan string)
    go func() { messages <- "ping" }()
    msg := <-messages
    fmt.Println(msg)
}

Channel Buffering

package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    messages := make(chan string, 2)
    
    messages <- "buffered"
    messages <- "channel"
    
    fmt.Println(<-messages)
    fmt.Println(<-messages)
}

OMG!!!

So, Yea... That's what's up.

Question #1

  • Is the security software we buy garbage?
  • or is it?
  • I'm just asking questions!

Question #2

  • Did large security companies destroy your industry
  • with bullshit marketing and shitty products?
  • or did they?
  • I'm just asking questions!

So, Beef with the current

  • Tables? Let's Talk.
  • Unstructured data
  • ... chill.. only in an Unstructured View
  • Metrics.. we have science now y'all
  • We have a job to do
  • This isn't a Sunday drive.

TABLES... NO... bad designer!

Tables != Efficient

  • Big Data.. BUZZWORD!!
  • Does pagination make sense still?
  • Filters.. It's like the new hot
  • Splunk, Arcsight, kibana..
  • WORTHLESS - Unless you like wasting time.
  • It's the applications problem to solve.

Unstructured Data

  • Collect Everything... cool.
  • Search anything... cool.
  • get work done... fail.
  • workflow... fail.
  • context... fail.
  • interface design fails.. OMG YES!

WorkFlow

  • X + Y = ???
  • Track The Incident
  • Metrics and History
  • Parallelism
  • Reporting Becomes Simple

Context

  • X + Y = ??? same concept
  • Designed To Search - Not Connect
  • pivoting
  • A lot can be automated
  • Storytelling

Tell a Story

  • design your interface to tell a story
  • steps to follow for value add
  • lead the user and push a process
  • don't over do it

SAVE TIME

  • More Reporting and Less Searching
  • Visualizations need to be interpreted (more)
  • Wordflow, Context and Process speed up response
  • We are going the wrong way.
    •

    current trends

    • Search, Search.. more search.. all the data
    • Store all your structured and unstructured data!
    • General search and display interfaces
    • Dynamic charts by type.

    My philosophy on this

    Tools VS Applications

    • Tools: search - Applications: find
    • Tools: export - Applications: create
    • Tools: Empower - Applications: Have Power
    • Both are great in the right situations

    Science & Stuff

    • behavioral profiling
    • pattern anomalies
    • Connecting the right bits
    • ultimately producing better results
    • false positives

    wtf does this have

    to do with interfaces?

    everything

    Your Interface Sucks

    • If you don't have the right data to show.
    • If you simply return data and walk away
    • If you don't offer value outside of storage
    • If your metrics are ridiculous *cough*Snorby*cough*
    • A good interface has nothing to do with design
    • but trust me.. its still very important too.

    Ok, back to Snorby

    Lessons Learned

    • Finding problems to solve is not always easy
    • There is a lot of room for more applications in OSS
    • Workflow needs a bigger spotlight imho.
    • Answer questions before they are asked (if possible)

    So, security interface design

    • Should be foced around a process
    • Should filter and ask questions vs paging data
    • Should still have metrics and dashboard but with more insight
    • Should use new technology and mathematics to focus your telescope
    • Should be ready for collaboration

    Questions?
